message.content:
Step 1. Calculate Free Cash Flow (FCF) by adding the net cash flow from operating activities and the net cash flow from investing activities.  
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –18,924,462.44  
• Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities = –2,670,827.47  
FCF = –18,924,462.44 + (–2,670,827.47) = –21,595,289.91

Step 2. Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio. This ratio is computed by dividing the Total Revenue (from the income statement) by the average current assets (the average of beginning and ending current assets from the balance sheet).  
• Beginning Current Assets = 20,000,000.00  
• Ending Current Assets = 20,314,894.50  
Average Current Assets = (20,000,000.00 + 20,314,894.50) / 2 = 20,157,447.25  
• Total Revenue (from income statement) = 20,318,450.67  
Current Assets Turnover Ratio = 20,318,450.67 / 20,157,447.25 ≈ 1.01

Thus, the solution in the required JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-21595289.91",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "1.01"
  }
}
